oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ service, 1996 November 30
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opened by Carl Porter and followed by singing led by Bill Pelfrey. Shade Miller, Bill Pelfrey, and Carl Porter handle a large rattlesnake, which is followed by laying on of hands led by Porter's wife. A congregant speaks in tongues, which is followed by preaching by a visiting preacher from Kentucky.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Glossolalia; Imposition of hands; Pentecostal preaching; Slain in the Spirit; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern
Miller, Shade; Pelfry, Bill; Porter, Carl
Church of the Lord Jesus Christ (Kingston, Ga.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:rightsHolder: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
